meanings.definition: Not pleasing to the eye; unattractive.
meanings.sent1: The old, broken-down house was truly unsight.
meanings.sent2: The muddy field was unsight after the heavy rain.
meanings.sent3: The unsight painting made everyone giggle.
meanings.sent4: Her unsight outfit was like a dark cloud on a sunny day.
meanings.sent5: The unsight graffiti on the wall was impossible to ignore.

meanings.definition: To make something unpleasant or unattractive to look at.
meanings.sent1: He tried to unsight the messy room by cleaning it up.
meanings.sent2: The vandals unsighted the beautiful mural with graffiti.
meanings.sent3: She unsighted the cake by dropping it on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The fog unsighted the view of the mountains in the distance.
meanings.sent5: The artist unsighted the portrait with a single stroke of paint.
